content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1921/einstein/facts/
ENDCONTEXT
Albert Einstein, renowned physicist, was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921 for his explanation of the photoelectric effect. Born in Germany in 1879, Einstein developed the theory of relativity, which revolutionized the understanding of space, time, and gravity. His famous equation E=mc^2 demonstrates the equivalence of energy (E) and mass (m). 

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
For what contribution was Albert Einstein awarded the Nobel Prize, and what is his famous equation?

ENDINSTRUCTION

BEGININPUT

Albert Einstein was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921 for his explanation of the photoelectric effect. His famous equation is E=mc², which demonstrates the equivalence of energy and mass.

ENDINPUT
